website_summaries.verdict: One of the most affordable race-oriented seatposts that is both durable and lightweight.
pros: Aluminum tubing makes the seatpost lighter than most other budget options made of steel
Two-bolt seat design makes it easy to secure a bike seat onto the top without it coming loose
cons: Small seat-angle adjustments are difficult to make without some major effort

customer_reviews.title: Simple Workhorse of a Saddle
customer_reviews.text: I had bought one of those cheap carbon posts here on Amazon that came shipped from China and ended up crashing when the post suddenly broke on the first ride out. I ended up returning it and just using the credit to buy a heavier, less-blingy aluminum post. Race Face products get the job done and I'd rather have the peace of mind knowing that my saddle isn't going to pop off under me.
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd W. Mcfarlin

customer_reviews.title: Bent Seat Post
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the post in December since it was well reviewed and a 'great' price. However, it only has ~15 rides and it's bent. For reference, I'm a fairly tall/large guy so the post was extended close to the 'minimum insertion' line (never over extended) and I'm riding full suspension on moderate/difficult single track trails. I recommend shopping for a more durable post if you ride technical trails. GOOD: - 31.6mm x 375mm fit frame, no issues with slippage as long as quick release was tight. - No issues with ordering/shipping, the product was received promptly. - The seat clamp did an excellent job of keeping the seat at the proper position/angle (applied blue loctite to keep the bolts in place).
customer_reviews.author: PH

customer_reviews.title: Good quality. Annoying to mount.
customer_reviews.text: At the end of the day it's a seat-post, but needlessly annoying to mount. The clamp nuts are not fully captive, so you have to hold them in place while turning your wrench until they're seated, and there's practically no clearance for a 1/4" ratchet to turn the front bolt, so I taped a rag around the post to avoid scratching the finish. I'll survive, but I thought we had seat-post design nailed like 20 years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Femia

customer_reviews.title: Awesome seatpost. Well done as you can expect from ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome seatpost. Well done as you can expect from raceface. I buyed for my hard tail, it was the last complement that i need to complete my bike components wich all are from raceface. Good price fro a seatpost. I be riding this for a month aggressively and i had mo issues. Im 5,8 and weight 174 pounds, had no complains that all. Highly recomend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Raul

customer_reviews.title: SSS - Solid Silent Seatpost
customer_reviews.text: My Cannondale didn't like the Thomson seatpost I was using. I was experiencing the creak from hell that wouldn't go away and antagonized me with every pedal stroke. Race Face was apparently the cure! This post is silent, doesn't slip, hardly flexes, and fit the tube perfectly. If it were a bit lighter i'd give it 5/5, but for the price this is expected. The Race Face print isn't obnoxious or flashy but compliments my bike well. I personally enjoy the two bolt design and found this model very easy to adjust to that sweet spot. Good stuff..
customer_reviews.author: DB BluBlock Productions

customer_reviews.title: Expected Race Face quality... it delivers !
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality RF mtb seatpost. Holds seat securely & never squeaks! Moderate in weight, also, the black finish & suttle RF logo looks sleek! Grade A.
customer_reviews.author: studpuppie

customer_reviews.title: Great seatpost for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great seatpost for the price. No offset, which helps get the seat a little more forward if you need it. Easy to adjust. The finish does scratch off a little easily if you adjust up and down or take your seatpost off a lot, even with the post greased. Still, only a minor complaint.
customer_reviews.author: J E Kurz

customer_reviews.title: Good replacement for an OE post.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in a pinch when I lost my original seatpost (long story) driving between races. It shipped quickly and I was set to race that weekend. Its still on my bike and doing the thing a seatpost does best. The matte finish scratches easily, but I don't care. The two bolts may occasionally come in contact with the saddle on hard bumps, but thats the norm with this style of seatpost. It was slightly lighter then the original it replaced too.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Lee

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It has been over a year now and this post is still holding strong. There are no signs of rust. It has supported my weight just fine and does not slip during my rides. It may be a little heavier than some other brands, but I am not concerned about the weight as I ride as a hobby and not a profession. Plus, the few extra ounces it adds just goes to strengthen my legs more. This has been a good replacement post.
customer_reviews.author: J. S.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Good, Sturdy Seat Post
customer_reviews.text: I needed a longer seat post than the one that came with my mountain bike. So I picked this up. It's much much longer than my old seat post and feels good and sturdy. Can't say there are really any negatives about it. If you need a good seat post, this product will fill that role.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: Not too much to say really, it's a seatpost that works well like it should. The clamp works great and it looks pretty good. It is a bit on the heavier side, if it really matters for a sub $30 seatpost. One thing worth noting is the paint does come off rather easily where the clamp meets the post, which isn't a huge deal considering the price but one should be aware of it.

customer_reviews.title: Quality!

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to adjust properly
customer_reviews.text: My biggest criticism of this seat is that it is difficult to adjust properly. I've had others that were a cinch to adjust the angle on. This seat post is more of a nuisance. It works well, once adjusted, but up until that point, it's a pain. I'd pick another seat post.

customer_reviews.title: Wel designed, well made, could be lighter

The seat post might be aluminum, but it is still quite heavy.

I usually use Thompson, but the point of my SS was efficiency and value and so far this thing works great and is strong without being a heavyweight. The rail clamping system is strong and simple.

The adjustments are easy to make with the two screw system, My only problem with it and why it only got 4 stars is there is no degree indicator to let you know that you have the seat at the proper degree. To set it I had to do it by feel and see what felt like me seat post before.

customer_reviews.title: Fits and works great, a really great value.
customer_reviews.text: This works really well. I've got a few bikes, and it's amazing how much the seatpost diameters vary. I was having trouble with my old seat post slipping down. The old one is nearly .1mm smaller in diameter than this one, which has pretty minimal sliding clearance - i.e. it's pretty much a perfect fit. I mainly bought it because I really like the 2-bolt adjustment, but as a bonus it fixes the slip problem and looks better to boot.

I was also able to set the angle of my seat properly. Durability seems good and parts were easy to install. I didn't scratch it at all. My old post got stuck so I had to use a plumbers wrench to get it off. I used a 31.8mm clamp with this.
